summary:
Technology and risk professional with an international and broad profile, focusing on establishing new capabilities and propositions in Mergers and Acquisitions world, via enabling team culture through coaching talents.

Major strengths are solid technology and risk knowledge, high organizational skills, time management, ability to work with highly-structured or creative projects, being a team player, yet, having ability to perform high quality work alone.

Motivation is driven by challenge and curiosity to explore and create something new.

awards.title: GLO-BUS: Developing Winning Competitive Strategies - Industry Winner
awards.description: This award signifies the participant's extensive performance as senior executive at the best-performing company in an industry setting where teams of students ran companies and crafted strategies aimed at achieving superior financial performance and market leadership; the exercise was conducted in a course at Ozyegin University.

awards.title: High Honors Graduate
awards.description: To become a High Honors Graduate requires high academic performance, alongside with social involvement within university's student life. In total, during the graduation year of 2015, there have been 5 High Honors Graduates.

awards.title: JATCAFA Nippon Foundation Scholarship for Successful Students
awards.description:
This scholarship was granted by JATCAFA (Japan Turkey Central Asia Friendship Association) to Successful Students from Central Asian Countries studying in Turkey. The selection process requires high academic outstanding and well-performing social skills like leadership, team work, etc.

The scholarship is awarded for two years and requires active involvement in various social events throughout the year.
awards.issuer: JATFACA (Japan Turkey Central Asia Friendship Association)

awards.title: Success Scholarship
awards.description:
This scholarship is granted on the basis of student's previous year's performance. The amount of credits completed should be higher than 60 ECTS, and therefore, the ranking of the student within the whole department should be in first 5%.

The scholarship is granted as cash installments to student's bank account on the period of 9 academic month.

awards.title: Performance Scholarship - Full Tuition Fee Waiver
awards.description:
The Performance Scholarship has been granted on the basis of ranking based on entrant students for the year of application. To obtain a Full Tuition Waiver a prospect student should be ranked in top 5% of all entrants.

The Performance Scholarship provides a student with a full tuition waiver for the period of 4 academic years ,and additionally, exempts from technological fees.

The scholarship is viable only if student sustains a GPA of 3.0 and higher.

awards.title: JA Asia Pacific Company of the Year Competition (JA AP COY)
awards.description:
The 3 day competition is JA Asia Pacific’s annual celebration of the achievements of JA Company Program students in the region. JA Asia Pacific, the Regional Operating Center of JA Worldwide, is the organizer of the competition in the region, supported by a JA member (Host country for the competition) as the event travel to different countries each year.
 
The competition is not simply a business competition for young people. The goal is to balance the business achievements of each company as a whole with the personal development of each individual member.
 
Therefore, for a company to win this award, it is not sufficient just to run a financially successful JA company or to have created an exciting product or service. JA company members must also demonstrate that they understand how and why the company performed as it did.
 
Judges will be looking for evidence of innovation and the application of new ideas in all aspects of running the company. They also will look for an understanding that continuous improvement through innovation is essential to the success of a business.

The team from Turkmenistan was awarded 1st place during the year of 2011, out-beating 10 other teams from countries like China, Japan, Guam, Thailand, Philippines, Sri Lanka, and more. My role in this competition was "Company's President" and responsibilities have been managing the company on all levels.
awards.issuer: Junior Achievement Asia Pacific and FedEx

projects.title: Next Generation Feedback e-Learning Service – A Novel Case Study by ICT-portti and GetListed!
projects.description:
The CEO of Liitos, Risto Ahonen, Leadership Instructor, and Sirke Lohtaja-Ahonen, Communications Instructor, needed help in developing their well-established feedback training to the next level. Their goal was to gain more scalability and to increase volume. Their ideas about deploying gamification and e-services reached project researcher Jesse Kaukola and lecturer Antti Tuomisto from ICT-portti at the Innostu! ICT:stä -seminar in October 2015.

There were immediate agreement on the research project, and the project plan was established by December 2015. The project included specification of the new service and a design of the gamified parts of the service. These two parts are delivered together with University of Turku and Turku School of Applied Sciences.

Get Listed (GL) service took care of the team creation at Turku University. The team was formed: Lisa Ratz (IoT and machine learning), Mahri Charyyeva (IT and business communications), Nella Sarapelto (games and holistic systems), and Esa Grönberg (IT system specialist). Esa is currently studying at IT department, and the others are students at Turku School of Economics.

profile_positions.title: Manager | Technology M&A

profile_positions.description:
IT Controls:
• Support process and control owners to understand risks within SOX, PCI or GDPR, business continuity etc. and assist them in determining optimal controls to mitigate risks
• Identify controls based on risks for compliance areas in each of the IT and business processes
• Provide support in the design, implementation and amendment of controls
• Enable continuous improvement, maintaining our Booking.com controls catalogue, by providing general and technical guidance on how to maintain relevant controls
• Monitor control performance of IT controls across the business for timely and effective execution

Governance & Change Management:
• Report on risks and control effectiveness to internal and external risk / audit committee boards
• Set the standards, operating procedures, templates and tooling
• Maintain risk register and track risk exposures against risk appetite
• Escalate any challenges in executing change (e.g. stakeholder commitment, technical complexity or resource limitations) in a timely manner
• Embed ownership and awareness in 1st line of defence via training and communication to control owners
• Foster an intelligent risk culture across B.com through communication, training etc.
• Update management on change progress

Audit Management:
• Support coordination of Internal Audit and External Audit efforts with the business
• Lead the program management of testing cycles and engagement with internal and external
• Track the mitigation of confirmed deficiencies from Internal and External audit, working closely with business partnering team
• Communicate and agree on control objectives with stakeholders to determine optimal and scalable solutions to mitigate relevant risks
• Obtain stakeholder commitment for implementing the required changes
• Escalate any challenges to meeting audit cycle timelines in a timely manner
• Coordinate & monitor implementation of changes by business units and functions
profile_positions.title: IT Risk and Controls Officer
IT Risk and Controls Analyst

profile_positions.description:
My main responsibility is to perform general and application control reviews for various computer information systems. In addition, my responsibility involves information control reviews to include system development standards, operating procedures, system security, programming controls, communication controls, backup and disaster recovery, and system maintenance. Alongside, preparation of audit finding memoranda and working papers is in my responsibilities to ensure that adequate documentation exists to support the completed audit and conclusions.

In a nutshell, I am skilled in performing IT Audit procedures in relation to financial statements, SOx 404 reviews, ISAE 3402 Type I&II and IT maturity assessments. I have worked with industries in Retail, Financial Services and Logistics and was exposed to projects execution in countries like Netherlands, Sweden, and France. Moreover, during my professional experience I was teamed and supported engagements in The Netherlands and India. During past two years I have acquired working knowledge of ERPs such as SAP and Infor, as well as tools like SAP GRC and SAP BW, HR SuccessFactors, SharePoint and ITSM tools like ServiceNow.

Skills:
Risk assessment ability
Internal audit experience
Communication skills
Interpersonal skills
Security testing experience
IT security and infrastructure knowledge
Knowledge of operating system platforms
Report writing skills
Analytical skills
profile_positions.title: IT Audit & Technology Risk Advisor

profile_positions.description:
The internship is performed in Financial IT Audit department of EY Netherlands.
This internship is a part of IMMIT master program. The requirement of the program is to fulfill the last semester of studies performing an internship in a company, while writing a master thesis.

Master thesis is related to professional judgment and decision-making within IT audit processes.
The research question is: "What procedure can be identified to systemize judgment and decision-making of risk assessment in a customized IT environment?".

Master thesis grade: 9.0.

Skills of focus: IT audit, IT controls affecting financial statements, IT landscape and infrastructure, behavioral decision-making.
profile_positions.title: Research Intern

profile_positions.description: Performed a role of international committee member that organizes various activities for both Dutch and international students of Information Management master track.
profile_positions.title: Active Member

profile_positions.description:
This is a part time freelance job that required written translations from Turkish language to English.

Most of the translations have been of a descriptive nature, involving understanding of real estate jargon.

Skills of focus: real estate jargon, written translations, Turkish, English, time management, discipline.
profile_positions.title: Turkish-English Written Translations (Freelance)

profile_positions.description:
This internship required me to provide support in online market research, development of online advertisement and testing of the online shop.

The market research included analyzing the new potential martkets for online shop's expansion in near future. Markets that have been analyzed are Slovakia, Austria, Germany, Russia, Turkey. 

Online advertisement has been performed via email marketing service Mail Chimp. The development of advertisements required desining the newsletter, sending out to customers and analysis of responses and follow-ups afterwards.

Testing of webshop has been performed over an English version of the online shop, which has been translated from Czech into English. The testing required analyzing deficient functionalities of hyperlinks within the webshop, checking upon grammar and design consistency with the original Czech website.

Skills of focus: analytical skills, grammar check, marketing research, PHP.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Department Intern

profile_positions.description:
Teaching assistants responsibility is course and outline preparation, attendance of the lab sessions, where business concepts are applied to the Microsoft Excel program, arrangements of the help sessions and office hours, homework assignments, quizzes, midterms and finals. Teaching the course to first year business and engineering students twice a week.

Front Office Manager's responsibility is managing the team of fellow assistants that are involved in face-to-face teaching and assisting of students. Preparation of weekly teaching material, and communication to the team on a weekly basis are main activities of a Front Office Manager. At the same time, management of course files on Learning Management System (LMS) is one of responsibilities.

Skills of focus: teaching, business concepts, MS Excel, team work, leadership, LMS.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant and Front Office Manager

profile_positions.description:
Dealt with the preparation of the designs of the plastic bags and ordering of the clichés
Managing the ordering and logistics along with all the needed documentation of the spare parts, raw materials for the factory production and clichés for plastic bag printing
Working with banks, composing of the import/export contracts with other companies, working with ministries of Turkmenistan for obtaining the certificates of accordance for the plastic bags produced by the company
profile_positions.title: Manager/designer

volunteer_experiences.description: During this period of volunteering for American Councils in Ashgabat, Turkmenistan, I have been involved in a lot of various projects. Taking various courses on self-development, leadership, team building, public speaking, and more, I have also provided some courses to other fellow volunteers and students. The courses were organized on a volunteering basis at the library of American Councils. I held courses in "TOEFL for beginners" and "Vocabulary for SAT". Additionally, I have taken an active role in preparation various summer schools in collaboration with American Councils and Information Resource Center (IRC) in Ashgabat, Turkmenistan. Moreover, I have organized several community projects like visits to elderly care houses and city cleaning activities. The last, but not the least, is my involvement as an organizer of Ultimate Frisbee Tournament in Ashgabat, Turkmenistan.
